results.brief_description: Briefly explains and illustrates potential, kinetic and radiant energy in mechanical, chemical and thermal forms, conservation of energy, power and work.

results.title: Energy and agriculture
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO and Chris Oliver
results.brief_description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.
results.description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.

results.title: Energy
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans, Oxford Films (U.S.) and Barbara Buce
results.brief_description: Explores energy in humans, animals, the elements and the earth. Shows how these kinds of energy are harnessed and how they are used daily in home and industry. Shows that pollution is a result of excessive use and barren devastation is a result of a lack of conservation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energetically yours
results.creator_credit: Walter Lowendahl, Transfilm and David Hilberman
results.brief_description: An animated film by Ronald Searle which traces man’s search for sources of energy to help him in his daily life. It tells of our need and use of energy since primitive times - from fire, through coal and oil, to the atom.

results.title: Endotracheal anaesthesia
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, ICI (GB) and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.
results.description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.

results.title: Endoscopic study of the prostate = Les Adenomes de la prostate etude endoscopique
results.brief_description: This film highlights the disease issues related to prostate medical condition focussing on the various issues arising with pre and post operation. In medical linguistics it explores the diverse complications of the prostatic cavity.

results.title: Endocrine glands: how they affect you
results.brief_description: Shows the location of endocrine glands in the human body and explains how hormones secreted by these glands affect growth, metabolism, sexual development, and behaviour. Discusses the use of animal hormones in the treatment of human diseases.

results.title: Endocrine glands
results.brief_description: By means of animation and microphotography, this film demonstrates the nature and function of the parathyroid, the pituitary, and the thyroid glands, and the pancreas. The use of insulin in treating diabetes is demonstrated, hyper and hypothyroidism are discussed, and stimulation of the mammary gland illustrated.

results.title: Endo what?
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Bower Bird Films, Megan McMurchy and Pat Fiske
results.brief_description: Endometriosis is a condition that affects about 15% of women between the onset of puberty and menopause. “Endo” occurs when the lining of the uterus, the endometrium, migrates to locations outside the uterus. This misplaced endometrium is most commonly found on the ovaries, uterus, bowels, bladder, ligaments, and on the Pouch of Douglas. This tissue bleeds every month and causes cysts and adhesions to form, sometimes binding organs together. Endometriosis often remains undiagnosed by doctors - the average length of time before a correct diagnosis is made is eight years. This short film features interviews with women of all ages and backgrounds who relate their experiences with “endo”. This video dispels the myths about endometriosis and offers positive suggestions for coping effectively with this condition.

results.title: Endangered
results.brief_description:
The following endangered species come to life from Australian stamps: Leadbeater’s Possum; Greater Bilby and the Stick Nest Rat. The film ends with a stamp depicting Australian Aboriginal, Truganini.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
